messages.message: We are sorry to tell that the system is out of order for the moment.
WORDFORM is not found in our lexicon. Could it be a typo?
WORDFORM should have initial capital letter?
WORDFORM has a typo?
WORDFORM is a misspelled illative?
You might have forgotten to write á in WORDFORM
Answering I-don't-know is too simple. Try again.
Do you mean 1. person singular? WORDFORM should have consonant gradation.
Your answer must always contain a finite verbA finite verb is inflected for person and number, e.g.: boran, lohká. Could there be a typo in your verbform?
"soaitit" should be used like other auxilary verbs, e.g. Mun soaittán boahtit.
WORDFORM shall not be a finite verb - perhaps infinitive is appropriate?
After "bargat" and "dahkat" another verb is not appropriate.
You should answer with the same verb as was contained in the question.
You must use negation verb.
You must use the given verb.
You must use the given noun.
You must use the given adjective.
You must use the given pronoun.
You must use the given numeral.
You must use the given postposition.
Remember to use locativeThe owner is in locative, and what one have, is in nominative: Mánás lea spábba. Click to read more about this..
WORDFORM should be in comitativeCase expressing "with": niibbiin, niibbiiguin. Click to read more about comitative. because of the verb.
WORDFORM should be in locativeCase expressing at/in/on or from: skuvllas, skuvllain. Click to read more about locative. because of the verb.
In illative the vowel should change.
WORDFORM is illative, but the vowel should change.
In comitative the vowel should change.
WORDFORM is comitative, but the vowel should change.
WORDFORM misses diphthong simplificationThe diphthong becomes a single vowel: ea - e, ie - i, uo - u, oa - o..
Misspelling, probably incorrect illative?
WORDFORM is a misspelled illative?
WORDFORM should be in illativeSome verbs, e.g. liikot, requires an illative: guollái, guliide. Click to read more about illative. because of the verb.
EssiveCase expressing "as": skuvlan, under what conditions something happens, or what something is called. Interrogates are: manin, geanin. Click to read more about essive. does not fit here.
Postposition does not fit here.
Be sure that singular/plural match.
WORDFORM should be in 3rd person, singular or plural.
Are you confident that WORDFORM is in the correct person?
Remember agreement between subject and verbal.
Are you confident that you answer in the correct tense?
Should be an actio essive.
WORDFORM has wrong form, after the negation verb.
WORDFORM should be infinitive.
Two negation forms are one too many.
WORDFORM is locative? Remember consonant gradation Veksling i konsonantgruppa mellom 1. og 2. stavinga i siste takta, e.g. giella - giela. Click to read more about consonant gradation..
Remember consonant gradation Veksling i konsonantgruppa mellom 1. og 2. stavinga i siste takta, e.g. giella - giela. Click to read more about consonant gradation..
Your answer should contain a numeral in singular.
Your answer should contain a numeral in plural.
Your answer should contain a numeral in locative.
Your answer should contain a collective numeral or numeral in locative.
Your answer should contain an ordinal number.
Are you confident that you answer with the correct case?
Your answer should contain an accusative Case for the object, e.g. girjji, girjjiid. Interrogates are: maid, man, gean, geaid. Click to read more about accusative. .
Remember that the whole object should be in accusative.

Your answer should contain a genitiveCase for the possessor: nissona, nissoniid. Also for the complement of post- and prepositions: nissona luhtte, and after numbers bigger than 1: golbma 'bártni'. Click to read more about genitive..
Your answer should contain a comitativeCase expressing "with": niibbiin, niibbiiguin. Interrogates are: mainna, maiguin, geainna, geaiguin. Click to read more about comitative..

Your answer should contain an illativeCase for motion toward or into something: skuvlii, skuvllaide, eller for mottaker: áhkkui. Interrogates are: gosa, masa, maidda, geasa, geaidda. Click to read more about illative..
Your answer should contain a locativeCase expressing at/in/on or from: skuvllas, skuvllain. Interrogates are: mas, main, gos. Click to read more about locative..
Det som er noe sted eller noen har, skal ha nominativeDen som har noe, er i lokativ. Det man har, er i nominativ: Mánás lea spábba. Click to read more about this..
Your answer should contain a nominativeCase given as the base form of the nouns, e.g. gussa, gusat. Interrogates are: mii, mat, gii, geat. Click to read more about nominative..

Your answer should contain an essiveCase expressing "as": skuvlan, under what conditions something happens, or what something is called. Interrogates are: manin, geanin. Click to read more about essive. does not fit here..
The vehicle should be in comitativeCase expressing "with": biillain, biillaiguin. Click to read more about comitative..
Note that locative means in or from the place.
Your answer should contain a locativeCase expressing at/in/on or from: skuvllas, skuvllain. Interrogates are: mas, main, gos. Click to read more about locative..

Your answer should contain an illativeCase for motion toward or into something: skuvlii, skuvllaide, eller for mottaker: áhkkui. Interrogates are: gosa, masa, maidda, geasa, geaidda. Click to read more about illative..
In front of a postposition the nomenet should be in E.g.: máná luhtte, mánáid luhtte. Click to learn more about genitive..
WORDFORM should be in essive?
WORDFORM should be in genitive?
WORDFORM should be in nominative?
The object should be in plural.
Are you confident that the postposition fits the question?
Are you confident that the postposition fits the question?
You should consider whether nominative goes with a transitive verb.
Would be better with a pronoun in front of the verb.
Remember "eret" after the placename.
Here you should have had agreement between demonstrative pronoun and noun.
Here you should have had agreement between subject and adjective.
Here you should have had agreement between numeral and noun.
Here you should have had agreement between "buorre" and noun.
WORDFORM should have had attribute form.
WORDFORM should not have had attribute form.
The time expression might perhaps not be appropriate here?
The time expression should perhaps not refer forward in time?
The time expression should perhaps not refer backwards in time?
"fal" cannot occur sentence-initially.
"na" can only occur sentence-initially.
WORDFORM is an interjection and can only occur sentence-initially or sentence-finally.
You must use one of the words in the wordlist in the left margin.
You have not used the appropriate adjective. Try again.
You have not used the appropriate form of the adjective. Try again.
Check the inflection of WORDFORM, it is following a numeral.
